Language barriers: If the summit is held in a country where the language is not widely spoken or understood, participants who do not speak the language may struggle to communicate effectively.
Funding: Organizing a peace summit can be expensive, and there may be concerns about securing adequate funding to cover all expenses.
Safety concerns: Holding a peace summit in a conflict-prone area could pose safety risks to participants and organizers.
Differences in opinion: Participants may have differing opinions on the issues to be discussed at the summit, which could lead to disagreements and hinder the progress of the talks.

Logistical challenges: Coordinating the logistics of a summit involving participants from around the world can be complex, and there may be challenges in organizing travel, accommodation, and other logistical arrangements.
